acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Since its rat LD50 = 110 mg/kg (IARC 17, 1978), the substance was classified into Category 3.

carcinogenicity.rationale: It is rated as "Group 2A" by IARC S7 (1987) and "R" by the U.S. NTP (2005). Based on these ratings, the substance was classified into Category 1B.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

explosives.rationale: It contains chemical groups (N-nitroso group) associated with explosive properties. Since no test results are available, classification is not possible.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on positive results obtained in mouse dominant lethal test and mouse bone marrow micronucleus test (IARC 17, 1978; Mutat Res, 352, 159-167, 1996), the substance was classified into Category 1B.

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure

oxidizing_solids.rationale: It is an organic compound containing oxygen (but not fluorine or chlorine), which is chemically bonded to nitrogen. Since no test results based on standardized testing methods are available, classification is not possible.

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: May damage fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: In rats that received single intraperitoneal administration of the substance on day 2 of gestation, abnormalities of the brain were noted in most surviving fetuses (IARC 17 (1978)). In rats administered the substance on day 11-13 of gestation, malformation of the limbs were seen in 100% of fetuses. In addition, increased incidences of micrognathia, hydrocephaly, and microcephaly were noted in rats administered on day 13-14, day 12, and day 12-16 of gestation, respectively. And retarded development was seen in progeny that was born from parental animals that were administered the substance during the organogenic period. According to Patty 5th (2001), non-oral administration of this substance at 20 mg/kg to rats was associated with clear cases of teratogenic effects. Furthermore, according to HSDB (2003), in a study in which mice received single intraperitoneal administration of this substance on day 2 of pregnancy, all fetuses died at doses that did not show toxic effects to parental animals—the toxic dose range for fetuses and their development was one order magnitude lower than the toxic dose range for adult animals. Based on these reports, the substance was classified into Category 1B as toxic effects on reproduction occur at doses that do not induce general toxic effects on parental animals.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: It contains chemical groups (N-nitroso group) associated with explosive properties. Since no test results are available, classification is not possible.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Nitrosamide compounds are generally skin irritants, vesicants, or skin sensitizers (Patty, 5th, 2001). Although this report indicates that the substance is irritating, classification of the substance is not possible based only on this report.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Nitrosamide compounds are generally skin irritants, vesicants, or skin sensitizers (Patty, 5th, 2001). Although this report indicates that the substance is irritating, classification of the substance is not possible based only on this report.

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: This substance is known to cause skin dermatitis, which appears to be sensitization dermatitis rather than primary irritation (HSDB, 2003). In addition, nitrosamide compounds are generally skin irritants, vesicants, or skin sensitizers (Patty, 5th, 2001). Based on these descriptions, the substance was classified into Category 1.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In Chinese hamsters administered the substance, damage to the pancreas and diabetes were noted (IARC 17 (1978)). However, since details such as route of administration were not provided, classification is not possible.
